text.title: Latin America | Latest News & Updates | BBC News
text.text: Latin America | Latest News & Updates | BBC News Skip to content British Broadcasting Corporation Home News Sport Business Innovation Culture Arts Travel Earth Audio Video Live Israel-Gaza War War in Ukraine US & Canada UK Africa Asia Australia Europe Latin America Middle East In Pictures BBC InDepth BBC Verify Home News Israel-Gaza War War in Ukraine US & Canada UK UK Politics England N. Ireland N. Ireland Politics Scotland Scotland Politics Wales Wales Politics Africa Asia China India Australia Europe Latin America Middle East In Pictures BBC InDepth BBC Verify Sport Business Executive Lounge Technology of Business Future of Business Innovation Technology Science & Health Artificial Intelligence AI v the Mind Culture Film & TV Music Art & Design Style Books Entertainment News Arts Arts in Motion Travel Destinations Africa Antarctica Asia Australia and Pacific Caribbean & Bermuda Central America Europe Middle East North America South America World’s Table Culture & Experiences Adventures The SpeciaList Earth Natural Wonders Weather & Science Climate Solutions Sustainable Business Green Living Audio Podcast Categories Radio Audio FAQs Video BBC Maestro Live Live News Live Sport Home News Sport Business Innovation Culture Arts Travel Earth Audio Video Live Weather Newsletters News News Latin America Honduras election on knife-edge as count delayed by technical glitch Vote counting in the presidential election is going into its fourth day with the two top candidates neck and neck. 2 hrs ago Latin America Honduran ex-president Juan Orlando Hernández released from US prison after Trump pardon Hernández was found guilty in March 2024 of conspiring to bring cocaine into the US, and of possessing machine guns. 2 days ago World Drug lord El Chapo's son pleads guilty in US drug trafficking case Joaquín Guzmán López's guilty plea comes after US prosecutors pledged last May to not pursue the death penalty against him. 3 days ago World Dozens missing as deadly landslide hits two boats in Peru Rescue efforts in Peru's central Ucayali region are being hindered by strong currents on the river, one official said. 3 days ago Latin America What was Honduras ex-president convicted of and why has Trump pardoned him? Juan Orlando Hernández, once called the key figure in a drug trafficking scheme that flooded America with cocaine, walked free after the pardon. 2 days ago World US cancels citizenship ceremonies for migrants from travel ban countries It is the latest part of the Trump administration's renewed immigration crackdown in the wake of a deadly DC shooting. 1 day ago US & Canada US defence secretary says he did not see survivors before follow-up strike on alleged drug boat The strike has prompted concerns that US forces may have violated laws governing armed conflict. 20 hrs ago World US-Venezuela tensions Why is Trump threatening Venezuela's Maduro? We look at what is behind the deployment of a large US military force to within striking distance of Venezuela. How the White House account of September boat strike has evolved Defence Secretary Pete Hegseth has distanced himself from a follow-up attack on a suspected drug vessel. Tracking build-up of US military planes and warships near Venezuela The US has justified its air and naval campaign as necessary to fight drug smuggling into the US. What is Cartel de los Soles, which the US is labelling as a terrorist organisation? The US says it is headed by Venezuela's president and other senior politicians, but some analysts say it does not even exist. 'We worry more about food' say Venezuelans living under threat of US military action While the US escalates a military threat in nearby waters, Venezuelans say the real enemy of the people is a sharp rise in food prices. Features & Analysis As lead changes in knife-edge Honduran election, will Trump fail to get his way? Former vice-president Salvador Nasralla has a small lead over his rival, the conservative former mayor of Tegucigalpa, Nasry Asfura. The five things that set the 2025 Atlantic hurricane season apart 2025 was an unusual Atlantic hurricane season. Darren Bett explains what set this season apart from others. Fracking has transformed an Argentine town but what about the nation? Argentina hopes that an oil and gas boom can benefit the whole country. Family reunited after a decade – now a Trump clampdown could tear them apart Marven's mother and sister could be sent back to gang-ravaged Haiti as a US protection scheme ends. Machu Picchu hit by a row over tourist buses Protests have taken place over the coaches that take visitors up to the world heritage site in Peru. Watch/Listen Is the US preparing for war with Venezuela? BBC Verify has tracked US assets in the Caribbean Sea, after military strikes on suspected Venezuelan drug boats. Mass brawl breaks out in Bolivian football match 17 players were sent off. 'We did it!': Countries celebrate World Cup qualification Panama, Haiti, Curacao and Scotland fans partied as their countries secured a spot at the World Cup in 2026. How lifting the Amazon's soya bean ban could threaten the rainforest The Amazon rainforest could face a renewed surge of deforestation as efforts grow to overturn a long-standing ban that has protected it. Protesters clash with security at COP30 climate talks in Brazil Demonstrators, some wearing traditional indigenous dress, broke through security lines of the UN climate summit. Latest Updates 2 hrs ago Honduras election on knife-edge as count delayed by technical glitch Vote counting in the presidential election is going into its fourth day with the two top candidates neck and neck. 2 hrs ago 1 day ago As lead changes in knife-edge Honduran election, will Trump fail to get his way? Former vice-president Salvador Nasralla has a small lead over his rival, the conservative former mayor of Tegucigalpa, Nasry Asfura. 1 day ago 2 days ago Honduras presidential candidates locked in 'technical tie', official says Right-wing candidate Nasry Asfura leads former TV host Salvador Nasralla by just 515 votes, according to country's electoral authority. 2 days ago 3 days ago Dozens missing as deadly landslide hits two boats in Peru Rescue efforts in Peru's central Ucayali region are being hindered by strong currents on the river, one official said. 3 days ago 4 days ago Venezuela condemns Trump airspace closure warning The US says it is fighting drugs smuggling, but Venezuela says Donald Trump's aim is to topple President Nicolás Maduro. 4 days ago 6 days ago Two former Peruvian presidents jailed in two days Pedro Castillo and Martín Vizcarra are the latest in a series of Peruvian presidents to be sent to prison. 6 days ago 8 days ago Fracking has transformed an Argentine town but what about the nation? Argentina hopes that an oil and gas boom can benefit the whole country. 8 days ago 26 Nov 2025 Bolsonaro ordered to start serving 27-year prison sentence for Brazil coup plot The Supreme Court says the former leader has exhausted his appeals and will start his prison term at a police station in Brasilia. 26 Nov 2025 23 Nov 2025 Bolsonaro says ankle monitor damage caused by paranoia Brazil's convicted ex-president blames medication for tampering with his monitor under house arrest. 23 Nov 2025 ...
